name: hardiness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to bear extreme conditions or difficult situations: He credits his hardiness to his childhood in the small farming community where he grew up. Hardiness is highly prized in this culture, second only to stoicism.
the ability of a plant to live through the winter without protection from the weather: Many places used elm trees almost exclusively, for their hardiness and classic beauty. The fern's fragile appearance belies its extreme hardiness. See
hardy
More examplesFewer examplesHe inherited his hardiness from his father.Fell ponies are noted for their hardiness, courage and adaptability. This variety was developed over generations for hardiness in hostile climates.Consult any book about the hardiness of a plant and you quickly find there are no definitive rules, only rough guides.
